metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
What we do:
Optimization: How do we decide what ads to show to who and when to maximize the return on investment for an advertising campaign? How do we apply that decision making algorithm 11 million times per second, for thousands of advertising campaigns at once?
Forecasting: Can we predict with confidence how many people will be reached by an advertising campaign, and how much it will cost to reach them? Can we do that months in advance?
Experimental design: How do we measure the impact of any changes we introduce to our optimization models? How do we quantify any tradeoffs those models may introduce (e.g., you pay more for each ad impression, but each impression is more valuable)?
Causal inference: How do we determine what ads are performing best? What does it mean to have a high performing campaign? (Hint: clicks aren't the answer!)
Machine Learning: How can we predict demographic information or interest of a given user by natural language processing and machine learning over hundreds of millions of web pages, graph mining and algorithmic optimization on petabytes of data.

What you’ll do:
Own a meaningful project. Have the opportunity to contribute to the development of new and existing data products, experiencing firsthand the day-to-day life of a professional data scientist. We believe strongly in ownership at The Trade Desk, and we are committed to you having something substantial to show for your time here that will make a positive impact for the team.
Receive one-on-one mentorship from an experienced Data Scientist and members of the Data Science team.
Collaborate with a globally-connected team where you will also interact closely with our product, trading, and engineering teams to oversee the implementation of your projects.

Who you are:
You might be a great fit for a Data Science internship at The Trade Desk if you
Are enthusiastic to learn (and teach) new technologies, machine learning techniques, and advancements in the AdTech industry.
Have an abundance of intellectual curiosity.
Have a deep understanding of statistical machine learning and optimization techniques.
Want to work with big data technologies such as Spark and AWS.
Have experience in at least one programming language (Python, R, Java, Scala, etc.) and are comfortable with SQL by the start of the internship.
Are able to deliver a convincing story, derived from data, to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Are enrolled in a Master's or PhD degree program.
Have an expected graduation date between Fall 2024 and Summer 2025.
Can work in our Shanghai office for the duration of your internship. 

What you’re looking for:

Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project that makes a difference? Are you eager to innovate? Do you want unique, large-scale, and highly complex challenges involving technology that is brand-new to you?

What and how you can contribute is what’s important to us. Our consideration is not limited by the kind of education you have or the specific technologies you have experience with. We care about having good people to pitch in. Our culture is creative, energetic, and collaborative. Those aren’t perks – those are just the way we do business.

If this sounds like you, we welcome your application and invite you to find out why The Trade Desk has been named to the Fortune Future 50 list and the list of 100 fastest growing companies as well as Yello naming The Trade Desk a Top 100 Internship Program of 2023 and why we received the Intern Growth Award!

#LI-PL1

jobs.title: 2026 China Data Science Internship - Deep Learning Focus (Based in Shanghai)

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
What you’ll do               

You'll own and deliver a complete software project, participating actively in all stages of design, development, and delivery. At The Trade Desk, we value ownership and are dedicated to ensuring that your time here leads to a significant and impactful contribution for the team. 

Receive close, one-on-one mentorship from an experienced software engineer   

Collaborate with a globally connected team of engineers, Interns & other teams and departments in cities across the world   

Work with new technologies across a wide spectrum of computer science, including distributed systems, petabyte-scale data processing, machine learning/AI, and UI/UX  

 

  

Who you are  

You are fluent in one or more modern programming languages, eg, Javascript, Python, Java, PHP, C and C++, SQL 

Have a firm grasp on basic data structures and algorithmic techniques  

You are comfortable working on an agile, distributed team spanning multiple time zones and continents. 

You have experience of software projects. 

You are a quick and self-directed learner. We provide close support and mentorship, but you will have ownership over the design, plan, and implementation of what you build.  

You value, seek out, and foster diversity. We are a global team from many diverse backgrounds, with different experiences and perspectives. To complement this team, you will welcome ideas that are different from your own and be skilled at finding and building from common ground. 

Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 

Anticipated graduation date between November 2026 and August 2027. 

Availability to work for 12 weeks during Summer 2026 (June–August) in Shanghai

Open to the possibility of rejoining The Trade Desk Shanghai office and same team for a future SWE full-time position.

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
Business Development Director, Taiwan

What we do 
The Trade Desk is transforming the way global brands and agencies reach audiences through the open internet. In Taiwan—a strategically critical and fast-growing market in APAC—our Business Development team plays a central role in driving this transformation. As a Business Development Director in Taiwan, you will help to lead our commercial efforts across key domestic and outbound advertising brands as well as agency holding companies.

You’ll cultivate trusted, strategic partnerships with our top clients, combining industry expertise with a strong understanding of each client’s business to drive meaningful, long-term growth. In this senior role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to shape vision, influence executive relationships, and deliver commercial success through a consultative approach.

At The Trade Desk, we’re proud of the culture we’ve built—one rooted in curiosity, humility, and collaboration. We value the unique experiences and perspectives that each person brings. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work and be their authentic selves.

If you’re commercially driven, creative, and excited to be part of a dynamic, globally connected team that’s reshaping the future of digital advertising in Taiwan and beyond—we want to talk.

What you’ll do 
•	Leads business development efforts for The Trade Desk’s largest or most strategic accounts.   

•	Proactively builds and maintains relationships with top executives at brand advertisers and agency stakeholders.
•	Acts as a master relationship builder, sales leader, and creative problem solver with strong emotional intelligence and professionalism.
•	Serves as a consultative partner to clients and internal stakeholders alike.
•	Accurately manage and communicate monthly forecasts and pipeline.

•	Partners closely with senior leaders to define and execute strategic initiatives.
•	Leads collaboration with cross-functional teams to ensure effective client management.
•	Thinks beyond core sales responsibilities to understand and contribute to the business holistically.
•	Represents The Trade Desk at industry events and serves as a public-facing voice for the company.
•	Identifies opportunities to improve operational efficiency and generate revenue; lead  execution of key strategic projects.
•	Acts as a bridge between Business Development and senior TTD leadership, ensuring alignment and communication.
•	Participates in product feedback sessions and working groups when invited, sharing client and market insights.

•	Takes personal ownership of company success and drives impact at a market level.
•	Evangelizes TTD’s values and vision to industry leaders; regularly presents at industry events to shape market perception.
•	
•	Contribute to The Trade Desk culture by bringing your full self.

Who you are 
•	Proven track record in business development and local/outbound sales within the Taiwan advertising ecosystem, with deep knowledge of the local media landscape, agency structures, and cultural nuances.

•	Leads strategic partnerships with top-tier Taiwan advertisers  and agency holding groups.

•	Drives new business growth by identifying, pitching, and converting high-potential accounts across verticals.

•	Builds and nurtures long-term, consultative relationships with key decision-makers at both brands and agencies.

•	Holds existing senior-level relationships with major advertisers and agencies in Taiwan.

•	Serves as a senior leader within the Taiwan BD team, mentoring and enabling junior and mid-level sellers to think and operate strategically.

•	Demonstrated success in sales leadership roles, consistently exceeding revenue targets and driving sustainable growth.

•	Skilled in building from the ground up—an agile, proactive self-starter who thrives in fast-changing and ambiguous environments.

•	Brings strong negotiation experience, including leading complex commercial deals with regional and global accounts.

•	Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable commercial strategies.

•	Comfortable engaging in technical product discussions, including roadmap prioritization and platform scoping.

•	Effective communicator with strong executive presence, able to confidently engage and influence C-level stakeholders.

•	Passionate about closing deals, owning the room, and driving measurable results.

•	Collaborates effectively with cross-functional teams, including product, marketing, client services, finance, and legal.

•	Able to advocate for Taiwan market needs within global teams while aligning with broader company strategy.

•	Active contributor to global initiatives, including multi-market client growth, product feedback loops, and international expansion.

•	Bilingual fluency in Mandarin Chinese and English, enabling effective communication across global and local teams.

jobs.title: Business Development Director, North Asia Outbound

location.name: Chicago; Detroit; Los Angeles; New York

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
The Trade Desk is changing the way global brands and their agencies advertise to audiences around the world. How? With a media buying platform that helps brands deliver a more insightful and relevant ad experience for consumers –– and sets a new standard for global reach, accuracy, and transparency. We are proud of the culture we have built. We value the unique experiences and perspectives that each person brings to The Trade Desk, and we are committed to fostering inclusive spaces where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work every day.  

So, if you are talented, driven, creative, and eager to join a dynamic, globally-connected team, then we want to talk!  

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:  

Serve as the technical and strategic lead for a portfolio of top-tier CPG clients and agencies, helping them architect high-impact programmatic strategies that align with both brand and business objectives. 
Design and implement long-term platform adoption roadmaps, tying together identity solutions, data partnerships, measurement frameworks, and retail media activations across global markets. 
Lead strategic planning and technical solutioning for complex use cases involving custom audiences (e.g., UPC, SKU-level), data clean rooms, advanced measurement (e.g., incrementality, sales lift), and omnichannel execution. 
Partner with internal product, data, and engineering teams to shape feature development and integrations that address CPG-specific challenges, such as closed-loop measurement, retailer co-op compliance, geo-fenced attribution, and cross-retailer optimization. 
Analyze campaign performance using SQL, Python, Looker, or other BI tools, and use that data to drive insight-driven business reviews, optimization frameworks, and experimentation plans. 
Develop tailored strategies for media mix modeling (MMM) alignment, first-party data onboarding, and retail media integrations that support both upper- and lower-funnel goals. 
Act as a technical translator between business and product teams—communicating platform capabilities and limitations in context of the client’s martech stack and organizational priorities. 
Establish yourself as a thought partner and trusted advisor to VP and C-suite level stakeholders across client and agency organizations. 
Lead knowledge-sharing initiatives internally and externally, including building vertical-specific playbooks, technical documentation, and omnichannel activation guides for CPG use cases. 
Coach and mentor junior team members in advanced platform capabilities, measurement theory, and client storytelling. 
Extract and synthesize actionable insights from advertiser data using advanced analytics, then translate those findings into tailored, brand-specific narratives and strategic recommendations that drive growth and platform adoption on The Trade Desk. 

 

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:  

Bachelor’s degree in a technical or analytical field (e.g., Engineering, Math, Computer Science, Marketing Analytics); Master’s degree is a plus. 
7+ years of adtech or martech experience, including DSPs, DMPs, CDPs, or measurement/identity platforms, with 4+ years supporting CPG advertisers or their agencies in a strategic or solutions-focused role. 
Deep expertise in CPG marketing challenges — from fragmented retailer data to SKU-level targeting, seasonal demand patterns, and shopper marketing ROI. 
Hands-on technical experience with campaign optimization, data ingestion workflows, and data transformation using SQL, Python, or APIs. 
Understanding of clean room technologies (e.g., Snowflake, LiveRamp Safe Haven, Amazon Marketing Cloud)and their application in CPG use cases. 
Demonstrated experience aligning MMM, MTA, lift studies, and platform-based measurement into a unified performance narrative. 
Fluency in identity resolution strategies (e.g., UID2, hashed PII, retailer IDs) and how they influence CPG personalization and targeting at scale. 
Experience advising on data governance, privacy regulations, and how these intersect with global CPG campaigns and audience strategies. 
Proven ability to influence product roadmaps and prioritize technical solutions that scale across large, matrixed organizations. 
Exceptional communication skills and executive presence; able to translate technical concepts to senior stakeholders across marketing, IT, data science, and procurement. 
High intellectual curiosity and an eagerness to solve ambiguous, system-level challenges with cross-functional partners. 
Proficiency in SQL and advanced Excel, with a proven ability to analyze large, complex data sets and extract meaningful insights. Skilled in building scalable, automated dashboards and reporting frameworks that translate raw data into strategic intelligence and inform product innovation. 

Preferred Qualifications: 

Experience integrating with or building retail media and shopper data partnerships (e.g., Kroger Precision Marketing, Roundel, Walmart Connect). 
Previous roles in technical consulting, solutions architecture, or platform strategy at a DSP, CDP, cloud provider, or enterprise analytics company. 
Published thought leadership or speaking engagements within the CPG marketing, adtech, or analytics space. 

  

The Trade Desk does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired; such resumes will be deemed the sole property of The Trade Desk. The Trade Desk is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
Job Title: Data Scientist II
Location: 1114 Ave of Americas, New York, NY, 10036

*Telecommuting permitted: work may be performed within normal commuting distance from The Trade Desk, Inc. office in New York, NY.

Job Duties: Use technology to develop AI based search, retrieval, and classification products applied to programmatic advertising. Design and deploy machine learning solutions with the objective to transform unstructured and noisy content from images and web pages into structured and actionable data. Identify opportunities to enhance the reliability of audience and contextual targeting strategies offered by the company’s platform. Build data pipelines using cloud computing and big data to analyze the content of hundreds of millions of URLs on a daily basis, and process billions of ad-biddings opportunities. Support the data science process and research efforts within The Trade Desk by documenting the results of research efforts and studies, and sharing knowledge with other Data Science teams. Build AI-powered chatbot to support users navigation on the platform, and enable users to access data insight about their ad campaign performance through natural language interactions with a virtual assistant. Use Python as programming language daily, along with tools and frameworks such as Pyspark, PyTorch, and Github to analyze data, tests, and build models.

Salary: $151,400 - $227,000/year

Job Requirements: Master's degree (U.S. or foreign equivalent) in Statistics, Financial Engineering or related field and three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related role. Must have three (3) years of experience with: Python and SQL programming; Machine Learning and NLP; Data modeling; statistical modeling; and deep learning frameworks and agentic AI. Must have two (2) years of experience with: Big Data & Cloud Computing; and version control.

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
Who we are 

The Trade Desk is changing the way global brands and their agencies advertise to audiences around the world. How? With a media buying platform that helps brands deliver a more insightful and relevant ad experience for consumers – and sets a new standard for global reach, accuracy, and transparency. We are proud of the culture we have built. We value the unique experiences and perspectives that each person brings to The Trade Desk, and we are committed to fostering inclusive spaces where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work every day. 

So, if you are talented, driven, creative, and eager to join a dynamic, globally-connected team, then we want to talk! 

 

What you will do 

Lead the development and growth of The Trade Desk’s regional business with advertisers and agencies that are our most strategic, high potential clients. 

Unlock new business and expand existing business for a mix portfolio of brand direct export in APAC and large holding agencies in Singapore and Malaysia.  

Define go-to-market strategies and execute on action plans to achieve annual revenue goals 

Guide, motivate, and support the team to achieve organizational goals by setting clear objectives, facilitating communication, managing performance, resolving conflicts, and fostering a collaborative environment. 

Working hand in hand with Client Service team to identify and close strategic up-selling opportunities by understanding core client business needs 

Partnering closely with global and regional accounts team to grow strategic accounts in the market and take lead for local activation 

Develop a best-in market solutions and vertical narrative with cross functional departments. 

Advocate for the value of programmatic advertising in industry events and client meetings across Southeast Asia to grow the programmatic share of wallet. 

Use knowledge of the market and competitors to identify and develop the company’s unique selling propositions and differentiators 

  

Who you are 

Proven track record of exceeding revenue expectations with experience establishing longstanding, consultative client relationships 

15 years of media sales experience, with 5+ years in people management 

Strong quantitative skills and negotiation’s ability, able to lead commercial negotiations for large global advertisers and agencies 

Existing relationships with decision-makers at Brands and Agency Clients in Southeast Asia markets  

Strong people management skills with hands-on coaching and mentoring experience 

A capacity to participate in technical product roadmap and product scoping exercises 

Programmatic platform sales experience is highly preferred  

Experience of working within the North Asia (especially China) region and strong relationships in the regional markets will be a plus

Job Duties: Develop, enhance, optimize, and maintain high-performance user interfaces using React for client applications. Build and support backend services in C# .NET for API integrations and distributed processing. Collaborate cross-functionally with UX, product, and backend teams to define and deliver robust solutions. Establish automated testing to ensure code quality and rapid deployment cycles. Monitor health dashboards and slack channels to quickly respond to any issues impacting customers. Participate in agile, distributed team processes, ensuring effective communication across multiple time zones. Leverage data to analyze opportunities and communicate the impact of work on operational efficiency. Review code from peers and grow others through example, mentorship, and teaching. Enforce front-end coding standards and architectural guidelines to ensure consistency across all projects. Proactively research emerging web development and security trends to keep TTD’s technology stack competitive, efficient, and secure. Salary: $151,400 - $227,000/year Job Requirements: Bachelor's degree (U.S. or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science or related field and three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related role OR Master’s degree (U.S. or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science or related field and one (1) year of experience in the job offered or related role. Must have one (1) year of experience with: software development; software code review; HTML5/CSS3 development; and Javascript.

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
The Trade Desk is changing the way global brands and their agencies advertise to audiences around the world. How? With a media buying platform that helps brands deliver a more insightful and relevant ad experience for consumers –– and sets a new standard for global reach, accuracy, and transparency. We are proud of the culture we have built. We value the unique experiences and perspectives that each person brings to The Trade Desk, and we are committed to fostering inclusive spaces where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work every day.

So, if you are talented, driven, creative, and eager to join a dynamic, globally-connected team, then we want to talk!

What you'll do:

Manage and grow a roster of key accounts by building strong client relationships, providing strategic recommendations and exceptional client service.
Collaborate with the Trading team to rapidly onboard new customers and provide data driven insights to clients.
Collaborate with the Business Development team to identify ways to grow current accounts.
Become an expert on the use and best practices on The Trade Desk platform and offer insights to clients on how to improve campaigns and meet KPIs.
Provide continual training to clients as new features are added to The Trade Desk.
Work with Product Management to help define features and drive enhancements to The Trade Desk platform.
Help build the Client Services practice, by creating training materials, best practices, sales materials and customer facing guides.

Who you are: 

2 + years of consultative, client-facing work with online advertising experience preferred
Outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities, along with an ability to collaborate cross-functionally in a fast-paced start-up environment.
Proven track record of growing accounts by forging a strong relationship with clients, understanding their objectives and recommending best strategies.
Effective time management skills – ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
Ability to collaborate across multiple teams and internal stakeholders as well as work independently on daily tasks.
Willingness to travel alongside a team up to 25% of the time.
Someone who is looking to grow into more senior level opportunities in the region.

The Trade Desk does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired; such resumes will be deemed the sole property of The Trade Desk. The Trade Desk is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

#LI-BM1

jobs.title: Senior Account Executive, Business Development, Agency
Senior Account Executive, Business Development, Agency (Independents)

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
Senior Account Executive, Business Development – Korea   

 

What We Do 

At The Trade Desk, the Business Development team fuels our growth by helping advertisers and agencies embrace the open internet. 

We partner with the most ambitious brands and agencies across Korea and the wider North Asia region to unlock the full potential of programmatic—across CTV, video, display, native, and beyond. 

We’re now expanding our outbound and omnichannel partnerships, connecting Korea’s leading advertisers with global audiences through data-driven, transparent advertising. 

 

About the Role 

Are you a proactive, strategic seller who can turn curiosity into consultative partnerships? 

Do you combine commercial acumen with a love for learning new technology? 

Do you thrive in fast-changing environments and value integrity, empathy, and teamwork? 

If so, we’re looking for a Senior Account Executive who can be both a trusted consultant and driven deal-maker — balancing relationship building with data-backed, insight-led selling. 

 

What You’ll Do 

Drive New Growth: Identify, prospect, and onboard new advertiser and agency partners across outbound and domestic opportunities (e.g., gaming, entertainment, commerce, tech). 

Strategic Selling: Translate client objectives into platform-based solutions, connecting brand and performance goals with The Trade Desk’s unique value proposition. 

Consultative Partnership: Lead with insights — conduct discovery sessions, present omnichannel strategies, and educate partners on the evolving media landscape (CTV, identity, data-driven buying). 

Collaborate for Scale: Work closely with Client Services, Marketing, and Global teams to activate, optimize, and grow accounts through structured joint business plans. 

Pipeline Discipline: Build and manage accurate forecasts and opportunity pipelines, ensuring consistency and accountability in Salesforce. 

Market Intelligence: Stay ahead of market, competitor, and industry trends to inform strategic recommendations and thought leadership. 

Cultural Leadership: Embody The Trade Desk values — bring curiosity, objectivity, and collaboration to everything you do. 

 

 

Who You Are 

5-8 years of experience in digital media, advertising, or ad-tech, ideally in programmatic, DSP, or data-driven sales. 

Proven experience developing new business opportunities and growing key accounts. 

Strong understanding of the Korean media ecosystem, with exposure to outbound or cross-border campaigns a plus. 

Excellent communicator — able to simplify complex tech into clear, client-relevant narratives. 

Analytical and structured — confident interpreting data, building forecasts, and crafting ROI-based recommendations. 

Proactive and strategic — comfortable leading conversations, identifying opportunities, and setting long-term plans. 

Empathetic collaborator who values shared success across cross functional teams. 

Fluent in Korean and English. 

 

 

Why Join Us 

You’ll be part of a high-impact regional team shaping how Korean advertisers engage the world. 

We offer an environment where curiosity is celebrated, integrity is non-negotiable, and innovation is constant. 

At The Trade Desk, you’ll grow not only your career but also the industry itself.

Job Title: Director, Business Development
Location:  1114 6th Avenue, New York, NY 10110
*Telecommuting permitted: work may be performed within normal commuting distance from The Trade Desk, Inc. office in New York, NY
 
Job Duties: Be the primary contact for customers and be in regular communication with customers to assess customer satisfaction and react to any issues. Compile industry trend data and campaign and spend data from various platforms to assemble client facing materials for the purpose of selling through products. Collect and analyze data related to customers target demographics and users, advising them on best practices of reaching intended audience. Use various platforms to analyze spend and marketing activity data to present back to customers to illustrate successful use of product. Help companies form their marketing strategy as it relates to digital and programmatic channels. Forecast all potential activity for customers and analyze various trends in marketing spend for those partners helping them to optimize activity. Responsible for being expertly aware of customers competitors, helping them to create unique marketing strategies. Closely monitor industry trends and trade literature to expertly speak to customers about state of the industry and guide them to adapt strategies. Attend tradeconferences to meet with customers and prospective customers educating them on company software. Develop and implement various procedures for company teams to service customers.
 
Salary: $117,042 - $179,400/year
 
Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree (U.S. or foreign equivalent) in Marketing, Marketing Management or related field and eight (8) years of experience in the job offered or related role. Must have three (3) years of sales experience working for an online publisher, ad network, ad exchange, ad server, or senior agency. Must have three (3) years of experience meetingcompany revenue goals, including developing strong client relationships at media agencies, pitching capabilities and customizing ad tech products and services to meet their programmaticneeds, and using Salesforce to track and report revenue. Must have three (3) years of communication experience, including speaking with C-level clients to pitch ad tech products and services within a large media agency. Must have three (3) years of negotiation experience including building commercial endeavors and rate cards for a media agency client. Must haveone (1) year of experience creating relationships with decision-makers at enterprise client level,including having directly sold media or ad tech services to programmatic teams and Strategic Investments teams. Domestic travel required up to 10% of the time to visit client sites.

jobs.title: Senior Finance Manager, Sales Finance & Strategy

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
About the Role 

As a Senior Manager, Software Engineering at The Trade Desk, you will lead globally distributed engineering teams building and operating large-scale, highly available systems. You will set direction, establish strong operating mechanisms, and maintain a high bar for engineering excellence, balancing execution speed with reliability, quality, and long-term maintainability. You’ll work closely with cross-functional partners to deliver meaningful business outcomes while growing leaders and strengthening team culture. 

What we do: 

We trust our engineering managers to grow, empower, and support our greatest asset, our people. At The Trade Desk, every opportunity to engage internal and external stakeholders is unique. 

In this role, you will manage teams responsible for developing custom solutions and strategic integrations for our major clients. You will partner across Engineering, Product, Business Development, and Technical Account Management to incorporate stakeholder needs and drive strategic outcomes. Your teams will shape their charter in alignment with the business pipeline, supporting some of our largest and most impactful client opportunities. 

Our system performs every day, 24/7, serving global traffic. It’s important that we focus on quality at scale in an agile environment based on collaboration, ownership, and trust. Our engineering managers are there to build trust with our talented engineers, understand their strengths and weaknesses, and ensure they are motivated and productive, while having fun and enjoying every day. 

What you will do: 

Own end-to-end delivery of complex initiatives with ambiguous requirements, align stakeholders, and drive execution to measurable outcomes. 

Lead and develop multiple teams across regions (including people leaders and senior technical leaders), build a culture of high standards, ownership, and continuous improvement. 

Define and execute the technical vision and strategy for your area, balance near-term delivery with reusable foundations and long-term platform leverage. 

Make portfolio-level decisions on what to build, what to standardize, and what to decline, ensure capacity is aligned to the highest-impact work. 

Drive architectural direction and quality at scale through reference architectures, integration patterns, data contracts, and appropriate security/privacy guardrails. 

Establish clear operating mechanisms for intake and prioritization, delivery governance, escalation paths, postmortems, and support models for production systems. 

Partner effectively across Product, Solution Consulting, Technical Account Management, Business Development, Data Science, and platform engineering to align roadmaps, manage expectations, and resolve escalations. 

Define success metrics and instrumentation to measure quality and business impact (e.g., adoption/usage, reliability, support load, and stakeholder outcomes). 

Own resource planning across regions, hiring strategy, org design, performance management, and succession planning to build a durable leadership bench. 

Stay close to architecture and delivery to guide tradeoffs, remove blockers, and ensure high-quality outcomes. 

WHO YOU ARE:  

13+ years of software development experience, including building and maintaining production systems. 

5+ years of experience managing managers and/or leading multiple teams through senior technical leaders. 

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related engineering field (or equivalent experience). 

Strong technical background in distributed systems, API design, and cloud infrastructure, able to guide architecture and tradeoffs at scale. 

Proven ability to run complex, cross-functional programs with high ambiguity, competing priorities, and external stakeholders. 

Excellent executive communication and stakeholder management, able to align teams and drive decisions with clarity and credibility. 

 Deep understanding of modern software development practices (engineering excellence, operational rigor, delivery mechanisms). 

Experience operating in an Agile environment across multiple concurrent initiatives and geographically distributed teams. 

Ad-tech domain experience is a plus.

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Software Engineering - Custom Solutions

location.name: Bellevue; Irvine; Los Angeles; San Francisco; San Jose; Seattle; Ventura

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
What we do: The Trading Team works with Account Management and Business Development to provide strategic recommendations to retain clients and grow their business.  The main responsibilities of a Trading Specialist are to provide detailed performance and pacing recommendations and be a platform expert who can not only teach the nuances to clients but can actively navigate and utilize the platform themselves.  Trading Specialists should eventually be viewed as a consultant to clients who are aiming to drive the strongest performance possible. 

What you’ll do: 

Spearhead strategy development to ensure clients stay competitive in key areas including first-party data management and activation, CTV consolidation and retail measurement. 

Lead data-driven conversations utilizing TTD platform and custom reporting to provide insights and tell client relevant stories to provide a full picture of advertising’s impact on business results. 

Consult with clients on their campaign goals and strategies to ensure they are maximizing the value TTD’s platform provides 

Operate as a power user of TTD’s UI and empower clients to also become power users to most effectively plan, execute, optimize and build on successful advertising campaigns. 

Collaborate with Account Management and Sales Executives to educate your clients, grow your portfolio of business and ensure buyers are up-to-date on TTD’s constantly evolving suite of products and solutions 

Build and own key relationships with client planning, trading and analytical teams. 

Collaborate with engineers, data scientists and product managers to solve complex technical problems including cross-platform frequency analysis, consumer journey visualizations and API solutions. 

Troubleshoot advanced technical problems including performance issues, measurement discrepancies and constrained targeting. 

 

Who you are: 

3+ years of consultative, client-facing work in ad tech (DSP experience is a plus!), digital marketing, finance or other data-heavy industries. 

Eager to constantly learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment that requires self-driven education and improvement. 

Outstanding problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to distill complex, data-heavy information into simple but powerful stories and insights. 

Strong interest in learning the underlying mechanics of a platform and the ability to act as a conduit between clients and product teams to consistently improve TTD’s platform over time. 

Comfortable with cross-functional collaboration with the ability to navigate ambiguous and complex problems and situations. 

Effective time management skills, especially the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines. 

Advanced MS Excel skills and the ability to efficiently wrangle extremely large data sets (R, Python, PowerBI and other analytical language and tool experience is a plus!).

location.name: Bellevue; Boulder; Denver; New York; Seattle

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value: Job Title: Senior Software Engineer Location: 10770 NE 8th Street, Suite 700, Bellevue, WA 98004 *Telecommuting permitted: work may be performed within normal commuting distance from The Trade Desk office in Bellevue, WA. Job Duties: Design and implement scalable software components and infrastructure within internal developer platforms and distributed systems to enhance engineering productivity and reliability. Optimize and refactor existing tooling, services, and workflows to reduce developer friction and improve system performance, fault tolerance, and maintainability across engineering teams. Conduct comprehensive technical design and code reviews for high-impact systems, ensuring architectural alignment, adherence to secure coding practices, and performance efficiency. Serve as a technical advisor to guide software design patterns and best practices across teams. Lead cross-functional technical initiatives by scoping and executing complex projects that span multiple services, teams, and domains, including dependency resolution, phased rollouts, and backward compatibility. Develop reusable frameworks and internal APIs to enable standardized integration and extensibility across the company’s engineering organization; own shared libraries or SDKs used by multiple services and teams. Use telemetry, logs, and operational data to identify bottlenecks, quantify the impact of engineering investments, and drive decisions around prioritization and architectural improvements. Salary: $212,202 - $274,700 / year Job Requirements: Master's degree (U.S. or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field and five (5) years of experience in the job offered or related role OR Bachelor’s degree (U.S. or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field and seven (7) years of experience in the job offered or related role. Must have five (5) year of experience with: REST APIs or gRPC; and Java, C#, or C++. Must have four (4) year of experience with: Microsoft SQL Server or MySQL; Grafana and Prometheus; AWS, including SQS, EC2, CloudTrail, IAM, AWS Autoscaling, CloudWatch, ECS and EKS; Kubernetes and Docker Container; and S3 or Azure Blob Storage.

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
Job Title: Senior Software Engineer
Location: 400 Spectrum Center Drive, Suite 550, Irvine, CA 92618

*Telecommuting role permitted: work may be performed within normal commuting distance from The Trade Desk, Inc. office in Irvine, CA

Job Duties: Implement software systems for our main trading UI platform, including developing new features, improving runtime performance of the backend, maintaining the microservices infrastructure in Kubernetes, and implementing data pipelines with Airflow. Design and build infrastructure to ingest front-end user interactions, process them with data pipelines, and implement mechanisms to persistently store the data for downstream analytics and ML workloads. Develop frameworks to run A/B testing allowing engineers to launch scalable A/B tests under the framework, including capabilities for adding key metrics to monitor and draw conclusion with statistical significance. Contribute to the main UI platform of The Trade Desk, including finding out users’ needs and coming up with technical designs that can satisfy users’ needs, as well as implementing them within a reasonable amount of time and cost constraints. Work on bug troubleshooting or improvements for the existing projects, work on upgrading all components under when the platform updates, including upgrading the platform to .NET Core or a new version of SQL Server. Coordinate with various stakeholders for projects on the main UI platform, including engineers, project managers, system analysts, and business analysts to find the key success metrics to define the success of projects, expected user behaviors, and translate the goal into metrics that can be quantified within the existing dataset available. Define the performance expectations for any new features added to the main UI platform, use profiling tools to generate database query, diagnose the bottleneck of existing logic, and able to mitigate and compare the performance before and after the change to prove the effectiveness of change. Maintain the CI/CD pipelines to deploy microservices to multiple environments by using Docker and Kubernetes command line tools in a fast, timed manner.

Salary: $166,500 - $249,700/year

Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree (U.S. or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related field and three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related role. Must have three (3) years of experience with either C#, .NET, Entity Framework, Razor/cshtml, React, Angular, TypeScript, CSS/SCSS, Node, Microsoft SQL Server, Git, AWS/S3 or similar cloud-computing tools. Must have three (3) years of experience with: client-server architecture, localization, accessibility, modern testing methodologies, and software-as-a-service; CI/CD pipelines; and using data-driven approaches to improve against KPIs. Must have one (1) year of experience with Kubernetes and microservices development.

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
Job Title: Software Engineer II
Location: 400 Spectrum Center Drive, Suite 550, Irvine, CA 92618

*Telecommuting permitted: work may be performed within normal commuting distance to The Trade Desk, Inc. office in Irvine, CA. 

Job Duties: Implement full stack software solutions utilizing database: SQL Server, Postgres, Vertica; Backend: C#, Scala, REST APIs, GraphQL APIs; Frontend: Typescript, React, Tailwind; and Infrastructure: AWS, Azure, Kubernetes, Docker. Act as a company-wide subject matter expert on measurement solutions including, but not limited to, The Trade Desk Conversion Lift, Third Party Conversion Lift, Carrier Activation Indicator, New Devices Indicator, and Inferred Brand Intent. Proactively monitor deployed solutions for bugs, performance concerns, and feedback using tools like NewRelic, Sumologic, and Grafana to ensure maximum operational excellence and user satisfaction. Include automated unit, integration, and end-to-end tests in the delivery of all solutions in order to prevent regressions and accelerate team’s development velocity. Design complex database tables, GraphQL schemas, and client access patterns to satisfy product requirements and address scalability concerns. Identify and lead implementation of new measurement solutions that can be built on top of The Trade Desk’s infrastructure and substantial data. Collaborate with product managers and designers using tools like Figma to influence project directions and general user experiences. Track project progress using tools like Jira to facilitate roadmap discussions with product managers. Act as the primary mentor for new team members and interns.

Salary: $166,500 - $249,700/year

Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree (U.S. or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field and three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related role. Must have three (3) years of experience with: any of the following Object-Oriented languages: C++, C#, Java, Kotlin, and Scala; software development code editors, including Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code, Rider, and version control systems, including Git; high QPS, distributed or multithreaded systems; and collaborating directly with Product Managers and Business team members to design and develop software solutions. Must have two (2) years of experience developing web services.

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
Title: Senior Account Manager, Shanghai

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
A client services pro, you’re comfortable managing and growing brand direct or agency accounts. 
You are passionate about digital advertising and growing China DTC brands globally.
You’re a self-starter with excellent time management and keen to learn and teach others with new technology.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
•	Lead a roster of key accounts, operating as a primary owner to drive clients’ growth. 
•	Become an expert on The Trade Desk platform, serving as a strategic consultant to help clients leverage platform capabilities, apply best practices, and translate market insights into winning media strategies and proposals that drive their business goals.
•	Collaborate effectively with the Sales & Trading functions to develop existing accounts or onboard new customers.
•	Contribute to building and standardizing the Client Services playbook by creating training materials, best practices, sales enablement content, and customer-facing guides that accelerate planning and executional excellence.
•	Empower agency partners to scale their business through continuous training, workshops, and strategic consultation.

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:
•	Bachelor’s Degree or above.
•	At least 5 years of online advertising experience required, 3+ years of client-facing experience, with proven track record of growing accounts by forging a strong relationship with clients.
•	Outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities, along with an ability to collaborate cross-functionally in a fast-paced start-up environment.
•	Strong communication, negotiation, and presentation skills, with ability to influence decision-makers.
•	Hands-on expertise in programmatic advertising (DSP, SSP, DMP, MMP, Martech, etc.) or experience in brand/performance marketing in an agency or DTC company is a plus.
•	Experience with outbound performance marketing in the mobile APPs ecosystem is a plus.
•	Proficiency in Excel and MS Office, data-driven mindset with the ability to translate insights into actionable recommendations.

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
We are looking for a strategic yet hands-on VP of Procurement to partner with leaders across the organization. This person will report directly to our CFO and will be responsible for shaping and executing a global procurement strategy that drives efficiency, scalability, and innovation.

What You’ll Do: 

Provide procurement and financial thought leadership, identifying and developing strategic opportunities to optimize spend and drive enterprise-wide efficiency 

Partner across Finance, Legal, IT, Product, and Operations to define and implement global procurement strategies that scale with business growth 

Distill data-driven insights from spend analytics and market trends to inform sourcing decisions and uncover recurring cost-saving opportunities 

Lead negotiation and execution of enterprise-level vendor agreements, delivering measurable business outcomes with minimal oversight 

Work collectively with global Sales, Marketing, and Client Services teams to align procurement initiatives with revenue and growth objectives 

Collaborate closely with product and technology leaders to ensure procurement supports innovation and time-to-market goals 

Build deep and lasting relationships internally across The Trade Desk departments and externally with strategic vendors 

Oversee risk assessments and compliance processes to safeguard data privacy, security, and regulatory adherence 

In many cases, you will be proactively identifying and solving procurement challenges before they impact the business 

Who you are: 

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred 

15+ years of procurement experience, with at least 7 years in a leadership role within a global technology or SaaS organization 

Proven track record of managing enterprise-level vendor negotiations and delivering cost savings 

Strong understanding of SaaS, cloud infrastructure, and technology procurement 

Experience implementing procurement systems and driving process standardization globally 

Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills 

Knowledge of compliance frameworks (SOX, GDPR) and risk management practices
